{"step_by_step_thinking": "Retraction of the protruded mandible refers to moving the mandible posteriorly from its protruded position. The muscles responsible for this movement are the medial pterygoid and the temporalis. The medial pterygoid muscle is located on the inner side of the mandible and is responsible for elevating and protruding the mandible. The temporalis muscle is located on the side of the head and is responsible for closing the jaw and retracting the mandible. Therefore, the correct answer is D. Temporalis.", "answer_choice": "D"}
